abstract: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas discussed his new tax plan, his recent birther comments, Mitt Romney and other issues with John Harwood.
snippet: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas discussed his new tax plan, his recent birther comments, Mitt Romney and other issues with John Harwood.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas is seeking to jump-start his Republican presidential campaign by proposing a new tax system: a 20 percent flat rate on individual and corporate income, down from the current 35 percent top rate, and elimination of existing taxes on estates, capital gains and dividends. He sat down with John Harwood of The Times and CNBC to discuss the plan, his challenge to a Republican rival, Mitt Romney, and other issues. What follows is a condensed, edited transcript of their conversation.
